title.narrative: 2.1 SUPPORT TO ENHANCE OVERALL PREPAREDNESS LEVELS.

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Technical Excellence In Humanitarian Action. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House 3 United Nations Plaza New York New York 10017 USA

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

document-link.url: https://open.unicef.org/sites/transparency/files/documents/Office of Emergency Prog Country Office Tender Notice.pdf

related-activity.ref: 456F/F0/10/002 2. CAPACITY (CO, RO & HQ LEVELS) TO PREPARE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: EMOPS significantly progressed towards the output through the global roll out of the UNICEF Emergency Preparedness Platform (EPP) and the leadership provided to HQ Divisions, ROs and COs to adopt the EPP and meet the minimum preparedness standards. EMOPS supported the IASC in revising of the Emergency Response Preparedness guidance | Status: | As-of Date:

title.narrative: Inter-agency is supported in the roll out and improvement of the IASC Emergency Response Preparedness (ERP) approach, guideline and tools, to ensure alignment and mutual support with UNICEF approach

baseline.value: Inter-agency supported in the roll out and review of the IASC ERP approach, guideline and tools, alignment with UNICEF could be enhanced

target.value: 2021:Inter-agency supported in the improvement of the IASC ERP and alignment with UNICEF approach

title.narrative: The Emergency Preparedness Platform is fully functional and is improved to meet users

baseline.value: Minimum viable product for the EPP developed (EPP1)

target.value: 2021:EPP is a mature platform, fully functional and meets well user

title.narrative: HQ Divisions, ROs and COs are provided systematic support in enhancing their preparedness levels, with emphasis on countries affected by high risks, as needed

baseline.value: Support is provided to HQ Divisions, ROs and COs, however it is not systematic

target.value: 2021:Support provided to HQ Divisions, ROs and COs is systematic (follows agreed decision trees)

title.narrative: UNICEF preparedness procedures, guidelines and tools are updated, improved and harmonized with other UNICEF risk management processes

baseline.value: UNICEF preparedness procedures and guidelines issued in Dec.2016, essential tools updated, some tools and specific guidelines to be developed, harmonization with GRIP is good, harmonization with ERM,

target.value: 2021:UNICEF preparedness procedures and guidelines are completed and harmonized with other UNICEF risk management processes

title.narrative: % RO/CO that contribute to inter-agency ERP roll out at CO level including development of contingency plans for specific risks and contribution to development action

baseline.value: UNICEF revising and rolling out its own ERP guidance, based directly on the IASC ERP approach 6 No inclusive approach to guarantee the most comprehensive and effective risk analysis process

target.value: 2021:80% RO/CO that contribute to inter-agency ERP roll out at CO level

title.narrative: % of RO/CO contributing to an inter-agency mechanisms and/or focal point on inter-agency Preparedness fora

target.value: 2021:UNICEF and inter-agency risk analyses, in particular the IASC EWEAR and the IASC ERP, mutually support each other
